titleStmt.title: Letter: 1869 The Education Rate. Hawke’s Bay Herald 23 February.

body.p: Sir,—In the Herald of the 20th, in speaking of the Education Rate, you say that you “republish (from the Times) what is probably a revised report” of what was said at the meeting on Monday evening; and as the editor of the Times, in his paper of this morning, has not thought proper to take any notice of your statement, and as his silence might be reasonably taken as meaning assent, I write now to say that I know of no revision of the report, having not only never seen it before it was published, but also had no communication whatever with either reporter or printer. Had I seen it I should have corrected a few words—such as “Te Aute school estate being worth £5000;” what I said was—containing 5000 acres.—Yours, &c.,
